title:
A characterization of generalized cospectrality of rooted graphs with
  applications in graph reconstruction
authors: Wei Wang, Wenqiang Wen, Songlin Guo
abstract:
Extending a classic result of Johnson and Newman, this paper provides a
matrix characterization for two generalized cospectral graphs with a pair of
generalized cospectral vertex-deleted subgraphs. As an application, we present
a new condition for the reconstructibility of a graph. In particular, we show
that a graph with at least three vertices is reconstructible if there exists a
vertex-deleted subgraph that is almost controllable and has a nontrivial
automorphism.
